com.revivedstandards.model

Class StandardBoxParticle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revivedstandards.model.StandardGameObject
      • com.revivedstandards.model.StandardParticle
        • com.revivedstandards.model.StandardBoxParticle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable, Updatable

    public class StandardBoxParticle
extends StandardParticle
    This class represents a standard box particle.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from class: StandardGameObject
        Updates the position, state, actions, etc. of the StandardGameObject. Any logic or physics should be done within the tick() method. Do not put drawing functions in here; it will mess up the physics loop. This method must be implemented in any subclass of SGO.
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Updatable
        Specified by:
        tick in class StandardGameObject

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Description copied from class: StandardGameObject
        Draws the StandardGameObject to the screen however the user defines it as. Do not update any game/object logic in here. This method must be implemented in any subclass of SGO.
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderable
        Specified by:
        render in class StandardGameObject

      • setVariableVelocityX

        public void setVariableVelocityX(int min,
                                 int max)
        Sets a variable velocity for the X coordinate. This value will be applied to the X velocity continuously over the life span of the particle. The range of values should be approx. -0.5 leq min leq 0.0 leq max leq approx 0.5 Other values higher or lower than +-0.5 are POSSIBLE, but it gets insane...
        Parameters:
        min -
        max -

      • setVariableVelocityY

        public void setVariableVelocityY(int min,
                                 int max)
        Sets a variable velocity for the Y coordinate. This value will be applied to the Y velocity continuously over the life span of the particle. The range of values should be approx. -0.5 leq min leq 0.0 leq max leq approx 0.5 Other values higher or lower than +-0.5 are POSSIBLE, but it gets insane...
        Parameters:
        min -
        max -
